title: Vomiting
data:
**Vomiting** or **nausea** is a [status affliction](/wiki/Property "Property") caused by eating

- [tripe](/wiki/Tripe "Tripe") as a non-orc non-caveman non-carnivore
- old [eggs](/wiki/Egg "Egg")
- rotten [tins](/wiki/Tin "Tin")
- [garlic](/wiki/Clove_of_garlic "Clove of garlic"), while [polymorphed](/wiki/Polyself "Polyself") into an [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") monster

After a while, it will cause you to become [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused"), then [stunned](/wiki/Stunned "Stunned"), and finally vomit and lose 20 points of [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) The final act of vomiting leaves you helpless for 2 turns, and actually cures [food poisoning](/wiki/Food_poisoning "Food poisoning"), though you cannot count on vomiting before you die: vomiting takes 14 turns, while food poisoning will kill you in 10 + 1d9 turns.

If you are polymorphed into a [rat](/wiki/Rat "Rat"), you cannot vomit, but are still helpless for 2 turns. [\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

You can cure the condition (and keep the nutrition) by:

- quaffing a blessed [potion of healing](/wiki/Potion_of_healing "Potion of healing"), a noncursed [potion of extra healing](/wiki/Potion_of_extra_healing "Potion of extra healing"), or a noncursed [potion of full healing](/wiki/Potion_of_full_healing "Potion of full healing")[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)
- applying a [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn")
- casting [cure sickness](/wiki/Spellbook_of_cure_sickness "Spellbook of cure sickness")[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5),
- eating a [eucalyptus leaf](/wiki/Eucalyptus_leaf "Eucalyptus leaf")

When you are nauseated, you [abuse](/wiki/Exercise "Exercise") constitution once in every 5 turns (3 times in total).[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit e9c813b6](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/e9c813b6ba4a77727aa208191c17d6af039293c8), if you vomit while standing on an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") you will experience negative effects depending on the altar alignment and your [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record"). If the altar is co-aligned and your alignment record is greater than -[rn2](/wiki/Rn2 "Rn2")(4), you lose one point of wisdom and one point of alignment record; otherwise, you lose 0-2 points of Luck, if your Luck is greater than -5.

## Messages

You receive the following messages:[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

- You are feeling mildly nauseated.

  You are nauseated for 14 more turns.

- You feel slightly confused.

  You are nauseated for 11 more turns. You actually become confused for 2d4 (more) turns when the timeout reaches 8, then 6 turns.

- You can't seem to think straight.

  You are nauseated for 8 more turns. You actually become stunned for 2d4 (more) turns when the timeout reaches 6 turns.

- You feel incredibly sick.

  You are nauseated for 5 more turns.

- You are about to vomit.

  You are nauseated for 2 more turns.

- You are about to hurl.

  You are nauseated for 2 more turns while [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating").

- You vomit!

  You vomit, leaving you helpless for 2 turns.

- You hurl chunks!

  You vomit while hallucinating.

- Your \[stomach] heaves convulsively!

  You vomit while hungry to the point of fainting already. This still cures food poisoning.

- Your jaw gapes convulsively.

  You are polymorphed into a creature that cannot vomit.

## SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), drinking a glass of salt water can also make you vomit.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/timeout.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 211](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.2_Release/src/timeout.c#L211)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 439](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.2_Release/src/mondata.c#L439)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 1167](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.2_Release/src/potion.c#L1167)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/spell.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 1181](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.2_Release/src/spell.c#L1181)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 1168](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.2_Release/src/potion.c#L1168)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/attrib.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 506](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.2_Release/src/attrib.c#L506)
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [src/timeout.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 160](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.2_Release/src/timeout.c#L160)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.2. Click here for more information.](/images/b/b5/Nh362-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.2. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.2](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.2 "NetHack 3.6.2"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-362}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Vomiting

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Vomiting or nausea is a status affliction caused by eating

  • tripe as a non-orc non-caveman non-carnivore
  • old eggs
  • rotten tins
  • garlic, while polymorphed into an undead monster

After a while, it will cause you to become confused, then stunned, and finally vomit and lose 20 points of nutrition.[1] The final act of vomiting leaves you helpless for 2 turns, and actually cures food poisoning, though you cannot count on vomiting before you die: vomiting takes 14 turns, while food poisoning will kill you in 10 + 1d9 turns.

If you are polymorphed into a rat, you cannot vomit, but are still helpless for 2 turns. [2]

You can cure the condition (and keep the nutrition) by:

  • quaffing a blessed potion of healing, a noncursed potion of extra healing, or a noncursed potion of full healing[3]
  • applying a unicorn horn
  • casting cure sickness[4][5],
  • eating a eucalyptus leaf

When you are nauseated, you abuse constitution once in every 5 turns (3 times in total).[6]

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Per commit e9c813b6, if you vomit while standing on an altar you will experience negative effects depending on the altar alignment and your alignment record. If the altar is co-aligned and your alignment record is greater than -rn2(4), you lose one point of wisdom and one point of alignment record; otherwise, you lose 0-2 points of Luck, if your Luck is greater than -5.

Messages

You receive the following messages:[7]

You are feeling mildly nauseated.
You are nauseated for 14 more turns.
You feel slightly confused.
You are nauseated for 11 more turns. You actually become confused for 2d4 (more) turns when the timeout reaches 8, then 6 turns.
You can't seem to think straight.
You are nauseated for 8 more turns. You actually become stunned for 2d4 (more) turns when the timeout reaches 6 turns.
You feel incredibly sick.
You are nauseated for 5 more turns.
You are about to vomit.
You are nauseated for 2 more turns.
You are about to hurl.
You are nauseated for 2 more turns while hallucinating.
You vomit!
You vomit, leaving you helpless for 2 turns.
You hurl chunks!
You vomit while hallucinating.
Your [stomach] heaves convulsively!
You vomit while hungry to the point of fainting already. This still cures food poisoning.
Your jaw gapes convulsively.
You are polymorphed into a creature that cannot vomit.

SporkHack

In SporkHack, drinking a glass of salt water can also make you vomit.

References

  1. ↑ src/timeout.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 211
  2. ↑ src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 439
  3. ↑ src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 1167
  4. ↑ src/spell.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 1181
  5. ↑ src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 1168
  6. ↑ src/attrib.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 506
  7. ↑ src/timeout.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 160

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.2. Information on this page may be out of date.
